entry.title: 10 Essential Tips for Moving in Chicago Winter

link.title: 10 Essential Tips for Moving in Chicago Winter

entry.content:
Moving during Chicago’s harsh winters presents unique challenges, but with proper preparation, you can ensure a smooth and successful relocation. Here are ten essential tips from the professionals at Fairplay Moving Inc.

1. Monitor Weather Conditions

Chicago winters can be unpredictable. Keep a close eye on weather forecasts leading up to your move day. If severe weather is predicted, discuss contingency plans with your moving company.

2. Prepare Your Home

Before movers arrive, clear all walkways, driveways, and sidewalks of snow and ice. Apply salt or sand to prevent slippery surfaces. This protects both your belongings and the movers.

3. Protect Your Floors

Winter weather means salt, snow, and mud. Place protective coverings on floors to prevent damage and keep your home clean. Professional movers will appreciate this consideration.

4. Pack Cold-Sensitive Items Properly

Electronics, plants, and certain household items can be damaged by freezing temperatures. Pack these items in insulated boxes and transport them in heated vehicles.

5. Dress Appropriately

Wear layers that you can remove as you warm up during the moving process. Non-slip boots are essential for safety on potentially icy surfaces.

6. Keep Winter Supplies Accessible

Pack a separate box with winter essentials: ice scrapers, salt, warm clothing, and hot beverages. You’ll want these items easily accessible.

7. Protect Furniture from Moisture

Snow and ice can damage furniture. Use plastic wrap or moving blankets to protect wooden pieces and upholstered items from moisture.

8. Maintain Indoor Temperature

Keep your home heated during the move, but be prepared for doors to remain open. Consider using space heaters in strategic areas.

9. Plan for Daylight

Winter days are shorter in Chicago. Start your move early to maximize daylight hours and ensure safety.

10. Have a Backup Plan

Always have a contingency plan for severe weather. Professional movers like Fairplay Moving Inc. are experienced in handling winter moves and can provide guidance.

Professional Winter Moving Services

At Fairplay Moving Inc., we specialize in Chicago winter moves. Our experienced team knows how to handle the unique challenges of cold weather relocations. We’re fully equipped with:

  • Climate-controlled trucks
  • Professional-grade moving equipment
  • Experienced winter moving crews
  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

Don’t let Chicago’s winter weather derail your moving plans. Contact Fairplay Moving Inc. at (312) 858-0611 for professional winter moving services you can trust.

Ready to move? Contact Fairplay Moving Inc. for a free quote and experience stress-free winter moving in Chicago.
entry.summary: Moving during Chicago’s harsh winters presents unique challenges, but with proper preparation, you can ensure a smooth and successful relocation. Here are ten essential tips from the professionals at Fairplay Moving Inc.

entry.title: How to Pack Fragile Items Safely for Your Move

link.title: How to Pack Fragile Items Safely for Your Move

entry.content:
Packing fragile items is one of the most critical aspects of any move. Proper packing techniques can mean the difference between your cherished belongings arriving safely or ending up in pieces. Here’s our comprehensive guide from the professionals at Fairplay Moving Inc.

Essential Packing Materials

Before you begin, gather these professional-grade packing supplies:

  • Sturdy boxes in various sizes
  • Bubble wrap for cushioning
  • Packing paper (not newspaper, which can leave ink stains)
  • Packing tape (high-quality, not dollar store varieties)
  • Markers for labeling
  • Foam peanuts for filling gaps
  • Dish packs (specialty boxes for kitchen items)

Packing Different Types of Fragile Items

Glasses and Stemware

  1. Wrap each glass individually with packing paper
  2. Stuff paper inside the glass for extra support
  3. Use dividers in boxes for stemware
  4. Pack glasses upright, not on their sides
  5. Fill all empty spaces with crumpled paper

Plates and Dishes

  1. Wrap each plate individually
  2. Stack plates vertically in boxes (like records)
  3. Place cushioning material between each plate
  4. Use dish packs for extra protection
  5. Never overpack boxes with dishes

Picture Frames and Artwork

  1. Wrap frames in bubble wrap
  2. Use corner protectors for valuable pieces
  3. Pack in flat, picture boxes
  4. Mark boxes clearly as “FRAGILE - ARTWORK”
  5. Consider professional crating for valuable art

Electronics

  1. Use original boxes when possible
  2. Wrap screens in anti-static bubble wrap
  3. Remove batteries from devices
  4. Label cords and accessories
  5. Pack in climate-controlled conditions

Professional Packing Techniques

The Double-Box Method

For extremely fragile items, use the double-box method:

  1. Pack the item in a smaller box with adequate cushioning
  2. Place this box inside a larger box with additional padding
  3. This provides extra protection during transport

Proper Box Loading

  • Place heavier items at the bottom
  • Fill all empty spaces to prevent shifting
  • Don’t exceed 50 pounds per box
  • Use plenty of cushioning material

Labeling System

  • Mark all fragile boxes clearly on multiple sides
  • Use “FRAGILE” stickers prominently
  • Indicate which side should face up
  • Note the contents for easier unpacking

When to Hire Professional Packers

While many people prefer to pack themselves, consider professional packing services for:

  • Valuable antiques and heirlooms
  • Large collections of breakables
  • Extremely fragile items like crystal
  • Time constraints that prevent careful packing
  • Long-distance moves where items need maximum protection

Fairplay Moving Inc. Packing Services

Our professional packing services include:

  • Full packing service - We pack everything in your home
  • Partial packing - Pack only specific rooms or items
  • Fragile-only packing - Focus on your most delicate belongings
  • Unpacking service - We’ll unpack and set up your new home
  • Quality materials - Professional-grade boxes and supplies

Cost of Professional Packing

Professional packing typically costs:

  • $25-35 per hour per packer
  • Plus materials (boxes, paper, tape)
  • Often saves money by preventing damage
  • Reduces moving time and stress

Common Packing Mistakes to Avoid

  1. Using newspaper - Ink can transfer to items
  2. Overpacking boxes - Makes them too heavy and prone to breaking
  3. Insufficient cushioning - Items will shift and break
  4. Poor labeling - Makes unpacking difficult
  5. Rushing the process - Take time to pack properly

Final Tips

  • Start packing non-essentials early
  • Pack room by room and label accordingly
  • Take photos of complex setups before disassembling
  • Keep a “first night” box with essentials
  • Don’t pack hazardous materials

Remember, proper packing is an investment in protecting your belongings. If you’re unsure about packing valuable or fragile items, the professionals at Fairplay Moving Inc. are here to help.

Need professional packing help? Contact Fairplay Moving Inc. at (312) 858-0611 for expert packing services in Chicago.
entry.summary: Packing fragile items is one of the most critical aspects of any move. Proper packing techniques can mean the difference between your cherished belongings arriving safely or ending up in pieces. Here’s our comprehensive guide from the professionals at Fairplay Moving Inc.
